overview_summary: This profile covers one neighboring landowner with an unknown stance on development. The individual is part of a long-established local farm family and holds moderate influence in the community due to deep generational ties.

neighbors.name: Anita Miller
neighbors.claims: The Miller family farm near Headrick was established in 1952 when Anita’s parents moved to the Miller homeplace ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/doris-miller-obituary?id=59328381#:~:text=sisters%2C,people%20to%20Jesus%20as%20a)). Anita Miller is listed as a resident of Altus, Oklahoma, and is one of four daughters of the late Doris and Carroll Miller ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/doris-miller-obituary?id=59328381#:~:text=She%20is%20survived%20by%20her,grandchildren%2C%20Jestyn%20and%20Jaysa)). Her late mother, Doris Miller, worked as Headrick’s assistant postmaster from 1974 until retiring in 1992 ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/doris-miller-obituary?id=59328381#:~:text=lived%20there%20until%201952%20when,people%20to%20Jesus%20as%20a)) and was a longtime member of the Headrick First Baptist Church ([www.legacy.com](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/name/doris-miller-obituary?id=59328381#:~:text=assistant%20postmaster%20in%20Headrick%2C%20in,also%20enjoyed%20puzzles%20of%20all)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Outreach via a trusted local farmer or community leader she respects can help build rapport. Emphasize respect for her family’s multi-generational farm legacy and explain how the development will not compromise the land’s agricultural heritage.
